channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Starts Lebanon Ground Invasion, and Hundreds Are Missing After Helene
Live Updates: Israel Launches Invasion Into Southern Lebanon
item.description: Israeli troops crossed the border for the first time since 2006 in a ground operation targeting Hezbollah. The Israeli military called for evacuations of more than two dozen villages in southern Lebanon.

item.title: Meta will produce its Quest 3S next-generation VR and AR headsets in Vietnam
item.description: The announcement comes as Vietnam looks to boost its attractiveness as a destination for investment by the world's biggest companies and a key part of the global supply chain.

item.title: As Crisis Builds, Lebanon’s Government Is Nowhere to Be Found
item.description: Already crippled by years of economic decline, political paralysis and other crises, Lebanon has little but its own citizens’ grit to survive the Israel-Hezbollah conflict.

item.title: As Crisis Builds, Lebanon’s Government Is Nowhere to Be Found
item.description: Already crippled by years of economic decline, political paralysis and other crises, Lebanon has little but its own citizens’ grit to survive the Israel-Hezbollah conflict.

item.title: U.S. economy is on the cusp of another Roaring ’20s, says UBS
item.description: "It’s quite possible that by early 2025 only the most pessimistic investors will need rose-colored glasses to see a clear path to a Roaring ‘20s outcome." The question is how long it will last.

item.title: Rescuers Push Through Helene Debris to Find People and Restore Power
item.description: In southern Appalachia, blocked roads and bad cellphone service have made it hard to find hundreds of people who are still unaccounted for.

item.title: Assange, in First Speech Since Release, Says He Was Jailed for Journalism
item.description: Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, said in public remarks in Strasbourg, France, that his imprisonment had set a dangerous precedent.

item.title: These eerily prescient words from Hollywood icon Sharon Stone might have foretold the Chappell Roan fiasco
item.description: "Nobody likes you when you have boundaries,” the Basic Instinct star said last year.

item.title: The Vance-Walz Debate: Four Columnists Brace for Impact
item.description: With Harris and Trump locked in a tight race, will the vice-presidential debate do anything to help or hurt either ticket?

item.title: Mexico’s First Female President Takes Office
item.description: A climate scientist and former mayor, Claudia Sheinbaum will be inaugurated on Tuesday as the first woman to lead the country.

item.title: Google will invest $1 billion in Thailand to build new infrastructure for AI and cloud computing
item.description: Google's expansion in Thailand will add $4 billion to the kingdom's GDP by 2029 and support 14,000 jobs between 2025 and 2029, the company said, citing a report from consultancy Deloitte.

item.title: Wreck of ‘Ghost Ship of the Pacific’ Found Off California
item.description: The rediscovery of the vessel, which was captured by the Japanese for a time during World War II, highlights the potential of underwater autonomous vehicles to map the ocean floor.

item.title: Why Did Israel Send Troops Into Southern Lebanon?
item.description: Israel says it aims to cripple Hezbollah’s forces in an area of southern Lebanon that the armed group controls, and where it has built tunnels into Israel.

item.title: Sizzler offers chance for free steak for a year
item.description: But contest is only open to people in a few states.
